page.title: 07The Wellington By-pass
page.content: Due to the pressure on the town centre from traffic the Wellington Relief Road was constructed to the south of the town. It was opened in May 1971 at a cost of Â£200,000.The route of this road largely follows the route of the early A38 which possibly diverged from its present route at Hockholler,running to Pyles Thorne, Webbers Grave and Bagley. A traffic survey was taken on this road at the same time as the one taken on the M5.During the fifeteen minute period only 3 holiday vehicles were spotted.Mainly the type of user tends to be either local inhabitants travelling around Wellington or going into Taunton, and Transport lorries working locally. Since the building of the Motorway this area has become much quieter.
